required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes for Offering Genetic Testing in a Tiered Approach
clinical_study.official_title: Breast and Ovarian Catchment Pilot Grant: Clinical Outcomes for Offering Genetic Testing in a Tiered Approach

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial reviews and develops a clinical operations workflow to identify cancer patients who meet criteria for genetic counseling and testing. This study may improve utilization of genetic counseling and testing amongst community-based providers caring for cancer patients in a rural and underserved area.

detailed_description.textblock:
OUTLINE:
PHASE I: Patients' medical data are collected.
PHASE II: Patients complete family history questionnaires and their medical data are collected. Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) subject matter experts and OMC providers review patients' medical data at bi-monthly virtual conferences. OMC providers will be consenting to release their patients' medical records to SCCA so that SCCA subject matter experts (cancer geneticist and/or genetic counselor) can identify patients with an underlying hereditary cancer syndrome to be offered genetic counseling and testing.
OMC providers receive coaching from SCCA subject matter experts for guidance on providing genetic counseling and testing to their patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify cancer patients who meet criteria for genetic counseling and testing
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to study completion (Assessed up to 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: The number of cancer patients who meet for genetic counseling and testing as identified by the study team and OMC oncology providers

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to study completion (Assessed up to 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: The number of genetic testing kits ordered and processed for cancer patients who meet criteria

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical and patient reported outcomes following genetic test results
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to study completion (Assessed up to 2 years)
primary_outcome.description: Pertinent clinical information regarding genetic test result and related outcomes (referrals, treatment recommendations); pulled directly from EHR, genetic test reports, and patient questionnaires

arm_group.description: PHASE I: Patients' medical data are collected. PHASE II: Patients complete questionnaires and their medical data is collected. SCCA subject matter experts and OMC providers review patients' medical data at bi-monthly virtual conferences. OMC providers receive coaching from SCCA subject matter experts for guidance on providing genetic counseling and testing to their patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical oncology providers at OMC who see patients with an active diagnosis of breast, ovarian, prostate, colon, or pancreatic cancer
- Patients with an active diagnosis of breast, ovarian, prostate, colon, or pancreatic cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- OMC providers who do not see patients with an active diagnosis of cancer
- Patients who are minors
- Patients with precancerous lesions such as ductal carcinoma in situ (the presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct in the breast) or colon polyps (a small clump of cells that form on the lining of the colon or rectum)

overall_official.affiliation: Fred Hutch/University of Washington Cancer Consortium
